title: Sketch Class: Considering Composition
description:
Registration opens on Friday, May 25 at noon.

Six Thursdays
July 12 - August 16
5:30-7:30

Multi-session sketch classes offer the chance to draw in the museum's galleries under the guidance of experienced instructors. All materials will be provided.

Understanding composition, the organization of visual elements, is an essential step in cultivating your drawing skills. In this class, you will learn explore and experiment with various compositional strategies by responding to works in the collection from diverse time periods and cultures.

As the focus of this class is less on building drawing skills and more of composing powerful pictures, some drawing experience is recommended although not required.

Click here to see all upcoming sketch classes and workshops. For additional information, please call (312) 443-3680 or email museum-programs@artic.edu. Classes are recommended for ages 16 and up.

To request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program, please call (312) 443-3680 or send an e-mail to access@artic.edu as far in advance as possible.

Please see the museum’s Accessibility page for more information.
